Our Latest Article... Your HVAC System Can Enhance Sleep December 9, 2021 The sound of a well-maintained heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) system is like a lullaby for a good night’s sleep. If odd sounds, such as banging, squealing, or rattling, from your HVAC system are keeping you up at night, it is time to schedule maintenance and regain a peaceful nighttime environment in your Texas home. Let our qualified technicians at A-Plus Mechanical Services inspect, clean, and, if necessary, repair your heating and cooling system. Your HVAC equipment will operate at peak efficiency and with minimal sound after a tune-up. You will notice the enhanced comfort and improved bedtime atmosphere in your Houston home. Sleep Helps Maintain Health Although the U.S Centers for Disease Control (CDC) recommends adults sleep seven or more hours per night, one in three adults say they log fewer hours. Insufficient sleep is related to the development of heart disease, obesity, type 2 diabetes, and other chronic conditions. It can affect mental agility and energy level and lead to accidents resulting in injury and possibly death. What Causes Sleepless Nights? Some adults seek professional medical help for sleep disorders, such as restless legs syndrome and sleep apnea, that prevent them from getting quality sleep. Lifestyle and environmental conditions also may cause restless and interrupted sleep. Sleep experts recommend that you stop using electronics, such as cell phones, television, and computers, at least a half-hour before bedtime. Skip the alcoholic or caffeinated beverages when you are preparing for sleep and maintain a consistent bedtime schedule. Set your alarm clock for the same time each morning. Too Hot or Cold You will sleep better if you feel comfortable. Keep your bedroom dark and slightly cool at night. Try keeping the temperature from 60 to 67 degrees Fahrenheit. Because a lower body temperature makes you sleepy, dropping the temperature at bedtime can help to promote sleep. Consider installing a programmable or smart thermostat to maintain precise temperature control in your Houston home. After you program your comfort preferences, the device will change the temperature for you at night and then increase it in the morning. Controlling Humidity The amount of moisture in your living space also affects the quality of your sleep. A-Plus Mechanical Services can assess your indoor air quality (IAQ) and recommend a solution to control humidity. If you have too much moisture in the air, your bedroom may feel stuffy, making it hard to breathe and fall asleep. A high humidity level in your home can encourage the growth of mold and dust mites, which in turn triggers allergies, respiratory issues, and asthma symptoms. Itchy eyes, sinus problems, and allergies can interfere with quality sleep. Humidity is at an ideal level between 35 to 50 percent. If it consistently drops below the minimum percent, it will result in dry air that can cause dry skin, chapped lips, and irritated nasal passages. A-Plus Mechanical Services can recommend a whole-house dehumidifier to reduce the amount of water vapor in your home’s atmosphere. Or we can suggest a whole-house humidifier to add moisture if the humidity is too low. These comfort systems integrate into your heating and cooling equipment to improve the air throughout your home. Schedule your free consultation today. Improve Air Quality Improve indoor air quality by having your HVAC system’s ductwork cleaned. Change your furnace filter every three months during the heating season, and consider installing an air filtration system to work in conjunction with your heating and cooling system. You will breathe easier at night. Regularly cleaning your bedroom will remove dust, pet dander, and other contaminants that can interfere with your comfort at bedtime. Polluted indoor air can cause health problems, including sore throats and congestion, and can interfere with your sleep. Make Quality Sleep a Priority Get a good night’s sleep by controlling temperature, humidity, and indoor air quality with the help of your HVAC system. Let A-Plus Mechanical Services help you create the perfect sleeping environment in your Houston, TX , home. Call us today at 281-970-5200 or request service online . When I spoke with David, I learned that there were different REME HALO models available—something other providers hadn’t even mentioned. His expertise gave me the confidence that I was making an informed decision. The installation, carried out by Joni, was quick and highly professional. It’s clear that ME Brown stands behind both their products and their workmanship. Almost immediately after the REME HALO was installed, I noticed a difference in the air quality and smell in our home. It’s been especially effective at eliminating strong odors—everything from fried onions to burnt food. Being new to Houston, TX, we had assumed that the mildew smell in bath towels after just one use was normal. However, since the purifier was installed, that smell has disappeared completely—even after multiple uses. This truly proves that the entire home is benefiting from cleaner, treated air every time the system runs. I would highly recommend ME Brown for all your AC/HVAC and Air Purification needs. Their professionalism, product knowledge, and service quality are outstanding.” - Preston K. Frequently Asked Questions What Are Common HVAC Issues in Richardson? In Richardson, the wide range of temperatures can put a strain on HVAC systems. Common issues include inefficient heating during winter and cooling problems in the sweltering summers. Systems might freeze over, blow lukewarm air, or show signs of wear due to increased usage. Regular maintenance, such as checking refrigerant levels and cleaning filters, can mitigate most of these issues. At AC Pros, we offer detailed system checks to ensure everything is working correctly to avoid these common problems. How Can I Improve My HVAC System's Efficiency? Maintaining the efficiency of your HVAC system is vital, especially with Richardson's fluctuating weather. Some effective strategies include sealing duct leaks, upgrading to a programmable thermostat, and performing regular maintenance checks. Additionally, ensuring your home is well-insulated can help reduce the strain on your HVAC system. At AC Pros, we provide tailored advice and maintenance services to optimize your system's performance. What Should I Look for in an HVAC Contractor? Choosing an HVAC contractor can be challenging. Look for a contractor with a proven track record, proper licensing, and insurance. It's also important to choose a company that has solid reviews, offers transparent pricing, and provides warranties on their work. At AC Pros, we pride ourselves on our customer satisfaction and high standards of service, ensuring that you get the best in the industry. When Should I Replace My HVAC System? If your HVAC system is over 15 years old, frequently breaks down, or causes your energy bills to skyrocket, it might be time for a replacement. Newer models are much more efficient and can save money in the long run. At AC Pros, we help evaluate your current system and assist in selecting a new, energy-efficient model that fits your needs and budget. What Can I Do to Prepare for the Installation Day? To ensure a smooth installation process, clear the area around your existing HVAC system and any pathways the installers will use. Make arrangements to keep pets and small children away from the work area. At AC Pros, we also recommend reviewing the installation plan with our team in advance to address any concerns you may have. This preparation helps the process proceed efficiently and safely. Get started by calling us at (972) 736-8864 or complete our online form to request a free estimate. The Cool Master Difference 200+ Happy Client About company Cool Master is a leading HVAC company in Houston, committed to providing high-quality residential air conditioning and heating services. We understand how critical it is for homeowners to have a reliable system that keeps their homes comfortable throughout Harris County. Whether you need installation, maintenance, or repairs, we are equipped and ready to ensure your home remains a shelter of comfort year-round. For over 30 years, our team has designed and built advanced air conditioning and heating systems in the Houston area for a range of industries. We bring that expertise directly into Houston homes, offering customized HVAC solutions tailored to the unique challenges of residential properties. From sweltering summers to unexpected cold snaps, our services are designed to help our neighbors in Houston stay comfortable without excessive energy costs or unnecessary stress. Precision Matters: Why Proper System Design Is Essential An HVAC system is more than just an appliance—it’s a vital part of the overall comfort and efficiency of your home. Improperly sizing or installing a system without considering the specific needs of your home can lead to long-term problems, including: Oversized Systems: It may seem like a larger system would provide better cooling, but an oversized unit often causes more harm than good. It leads to higher upfront costs, increased monthly energy bills, inefficient humidity control, inconsistent temperature regulation, and excessive noise. Undersized Systems: A unit that is too small will struggle to keep up with demand, running continuously and driving up energy costs. It may fail to properly cool or dehumidify the home, resulting in poor airflow, uneven temperatures, and excessive wear and tear that shortens the system’s operational life. Many homeowners unknowingly suffer from inefficient systems that were not designed with the specifications of their homes in mind. At Cool Master, we take a scientific and data-driven approach to residential air conditioning and heating for homes in Houston, ensuring every installation is correctly sized and optimized for maximum efficiency and comfort. Featured Services Our Services Include More Services FREE Consultation & Assessment System Upgrade New System IAQ Assessment FREE Consultation and Assessment of Existing Air-conditioning and heating system: Includes attending to homeowner calls and providing a free assessment of current system condition as well as a recommended solution. Service Details SYSTEM UPGRADE: : upgrades recommendations may include additional supply/return flexible ductworks and air registers, introducing air purification/filtration systems, humidification/dehumidification, attic insulation, replacement of system components (cooling coil, condenser, furnace, heating coil, thermostat). All recommendations shall be discussed in order to achieve the satisfaction of the customer/homeowner. Service Details NEW SYSTEM: : For an aged system that has deteriorated and is running high maintenance and utility bills, replacement becomes the more viable solution. A system replacement may include a condenser, furnace, cooling coil, ductworks, registers, thermostat, electrical connections, disconnect switch, drain line and drain overflow protection. Service Details INDOOR AIR QUALITY (IAQ) ASSESSMENT: IAQ has a direct impact to homeowner’s health and wellbeing, which should be a paramount look at by the homeowner and their comfort consultant. Service Details Step 1 Step 2 Step 3 Step 4 Step 5 Target: Conduct initial 15 minutes meeting with customer/homeowner Result: Better understanding of customer/homeowner needs and requirements. Target: Perform house survey and conduct temperature, humidity, and air flow measurements for essential and critical spaces. Result: Internal temperature, humidity, and airflow reflect existing system performance, malfunctions, and required ducting repairs. Target: Perform house visual air leakage survey. Result: Identify leakage areas, problematic zones, and areas needing special attention. Target: Collect existing system details and run a health check. Result: Provide basic information on the installed system and its condition. Target: Result and conclusions wrap-up meeting. Result: Provide customer/homeowner with options that meet their needs. Delivering comfort for your family since 1972. Contact Us Expert A/C Repair Services in Dallas, TX Sala Air Conditioning is an air conditioning and heating service repair company in Dallas, Texas. We service, repair, maintain, and install all makes and models of heating and air equipment in Dallas, TX and surrounding areas. If you need immediate service now, call Sala Air Conditioning. 214-742-7252 Our Services Indoor Air Quality Solutions Check Out Our Products Our product line includes indoor air quality products to make your home cleaner and safer to breath. Germ Killer UV Light Air Purifiers Humidifiers Smart Thermostats Frequently Asked Questions about A/C and Heating Ask Us Anything What should I do if my heater isn't working in Dallas? Our team at Sala Air Conditioning can help with prompt heat repair Dallas TX. Contact us today! What is the average life expectancy of equipment? Most systems have a lifetime of 10 to 20 years. As your equipment gets older, its efficiency can decrease dramatically. You may notice that it gets noisier and needs repairs more often. When a unit begins to show its age, you have two choices. You can overhaul the system or replace it. Because heating and cooling technologies improve over time, a new system designed with newer, more energy-efficient equipment makes sense, especially if your system is 10 or more years old. We can estimate the cost of a new system as well as a payback schedule that will show you how newer technology will pay you back in lower energy usage. Can I just replace the outdoor unit on an older system to save money? No. Replacing only the outdoor unit will lower the efficiency of the unit. In fact, you can lose up to 15% of the unit’s efficiency! You should always replace the indoor cooling coil with the outdoor unit. We would prefer that if you replace the outdoor unit, you should replace you indoor cooling coil as well. Will a bigger sized system perform better? No. you don’t want your air conditioner to be too big. Air conditioners control the comfort level in your home by cooling the air and by removing humidity. An oversized air conditioner will cool your home faster, but it will use more energy and will not remove humidity adequately. A unit that is too big for your home will have short run cycles. It may take only a short time to cool the air, but the unit shuts off before enough air blows across the indoor coil where moisture condenses into water and drains from your system. Too much moisture left in the air can lead to mold and mildew problems. These short run cycles also mean your system starts and stops more often, which uses more energy and causes a lot of wear and tear. An air conditioner operates more efficiently during long run cycles. The same holds true with heating systems. An oversized furnace will warm the house quicker, but it uses more fuel and causes greater temperature swings in the home. We provide drain cleaning, sewer repair, and hydro jetting services that solve problems at the source. Dallas clay soil expands and contracts with weather changes, putting pressure on sewer lines. Older neighborhoods often have tree roots that intrude into pipes. We use video inspection technology to see exactly what's blocking your drains. For tough clogs, hydro jetting clears years of buildup from pipe walls. Our drain and sewer services include clogged drain repair, sewer cleaning, and complete sewer line replacement when needed. We explain what we find, show you the video footage, and provide pricing for lasting solutions. Air Conditioning Repair Service Dallas Dallas summers demand reliable cooling. When temperatures climb past 100°F for weeks and your AC breaks down, you can't wait days for repairs. Our AC repair team stocks common parts on trucks so we can complete most repairs during the first visit. We handle emergency AC repair and system diagnostics. When your compressor fails, refrigerant leaks, or your system stops cooling, we diagnose the problem and provide repair options with upfront pricing. Families with young children or elderly relatives get priority scheduling during heat emergencies. Common AC repairs include compressor replacement, refrigerant recharge, condenser coil cleaning, and blower motor repair. When your AC needs repair in Dallas, we respond with the parts and expertise to get your home comfortable again. Air Conditioning Contractor Dallas Installing air conditioning in Dallas requires understanding local climate challenges. Texas heat means your AC runs harder and longer than systems in cooler regions. We've completed thousands of AC installations across the Dallas area. Most Dallas homes need 3 to 5 ton units to handle cooling demands. Proper installation matters as much as system size. We install American Standard, Lennox, Trane, and Goodman systems sized specifically for your home's cooling load. Energy efficient models may qualify for CenterPoint Energy rebates and can cut summer electric bills by $100 or more per month. Our installations include central air conditioning, ductless mini split systems, and multi-zone solutions for larger homes. When we complete your installation, your system is tested, balanced, and ready to handle Dallas summer heat. Electrician Dallas Modern homes need electrical systems that handle today's power demands safely. Our licensed electricians work on projects ranging from simple repairs to whole-home electrical upgrades. Texas storms and power grid challenges make electrical reliability important for local homes. We handle panel upgrades, GFCI outlet installation, ceiling fan installation, and EV charger installation. Our electrical services include surge protection that guards your electronics and appliances from voltage spikes. Every electrician on our team is state-licensed and trained on current electrical standards. Whether you need outlet installation, circuit breaker replacement, or generator installation, we provide upfront pricing and professional work that protects your family's safety. HVAC Contractor Dallas Complete home comfort requires heating and cooling systems that work together efficiently. Our HVAC contractors handle new construction installations, system retrofits, and comprehensive upgrades for Dallas homes. We install HVAC zoning systems that control temperatures independently in different rooms. Smart HVAC systems connect to your phone and adjust automatically for comfort and energy savings. Indoor air quality solutions like UV filtration and HEPA systems remove allergens, bacteria, and particles from the air throughout your home. Ductwork installation and sealing ensures your system performs efficiently. Our maintenance programs include filter replacement, system inspections, and preventive service that catches problems early. Regular maintenance reduces energy costs and prevents breakdowns during extreme weather. Heating Contractor Dallas Dallas winters may be short, but reliable heating matters when temperatures drop. We service gas furnaces, heat pumps, and electric heating systems during cold snaps. Most heating calls happen during the coldest weeks when equipment that sat unused suddenly doesn't work. Systems idle most of the year often fail when you need them. Pilot lights go out. Thermocouples corrode. Blower motors seize up. When a blue norther drops temperatures 40°F overnight, our heating contractors respond quickly to restore warmth to your home. Pre-season tune-ups catch problems before cold weather arrives. We check gas connections, test safety controls, clean burners, and verify proper airflow. Whether you need furnace repair, heat pump service, or new installation, our technicians size and install systems properly to keep Dallas homes warm during winter weather. Water Filtration & Treatment Dallas Dallas area water quality varies by neighborhood. Many families choose filtration systems for better taste and health benefits. We install reverse osmosis systems, whole-house filters, and water softeners that address specific local water issues. Hard water minerals damage water heaters, dishwashers, and washing machines. White buildup on faucets comes from mineral deposits. Hard water affects how soap lathers and can dry out skin and hair. Water softeners remove these minerals and extend the life of your plumbing fixtures and appliances. Filtration systems remove chlorine taste and odor while improving drinking water quality. Reverse osmosis provides purified water at your kitchen sink. Whole-house filters treat water throughout your entire home. Call (214) 823-9958 Happy MB Kiser customer since 2014. Great company, very dependable and always on time. My A/C bit the dust on Monday, and they sent a tech to fix it right away. A broken A/C in Texas during summer time is as good as a death sentence lol. Luckily these guys are always around. Thank you the MB Kiser team and Jordan in particular. Big thanks to Kristen for expediting the part ordering. Oleg M. OVERALL EXPERIENCE WAS 100% POSITIVE. Kathleen M. Well we used them twice and both times were happy with the price and work that was done. Susan M. They are great. Our downstairs unit went out. They were able to put in the model I wanted. It was a 5 ton horizontal system, and a difficult installation. They had the resources to get it done. They ran into some problems but they charged us what the original bid was. They were also able to fix the upstairs air conditioning. They are very professional and always respectful. They were able to troubleshoot as they went along. If there were any problems, they were able to fix them. Anna A. Thank you so much for your consideration. I truly appreciate your service to keep my aged system working. Vincent F. I have now used MB Kiser for about 12 years. They have always been fast and honest. Recently, I had my AC go out at my office they fixed it fast with a $35 capacitor. The repair person I had out before Kiser tried to sell me an entire hvac system. Kiser also repaired one of my home units at 8pm on a hot evening fast and easy. Much to my amazement they did not even charge for emergency or afterhours. M.B. Kiser is wonderful to work with. K. B. We had our second HVAC system installed by M.B. Kiser today. They are excellent. The installation team arrived at 8:30 and left at 6 with all the work complete, area cleaned up and a great Carrier Infinity system installed. We have two systems in our house. We had the same setup installed last year and it has been flawless. The prices are competitive and the installers and service people are professional, competent and excellent communicators. Highly recommend. John P. Annual maintenance plan is pretty straightforward and a much better value than paying twice a year for the same service at twice the rate. Service manager came out after the first call didn’t fix it, and made sure the unit cooled. Awesome service and friendly people. Daniel M. I have used MB Kiser three times now at two different properties. Kenny and John are the best techs I have come across. This is a company that really puts their customers first which probably explains why they have been around so long. David W. Living in Texas we learn to appreciate our Air conditioners! I was ready to freak out yesterday when my unit stopped working and I am expecting some family over this weekend for the holidays! I started searching for a reputable air conditioning company in the metroplex. Couple of my friends at work referred me to MB Kiser and I decided to give them a try! I have called their customer service and lady on the phone was very knowledgeable and willing to help, which was a big plus for me. Amy D. THIS COMPANY DOES BOTH COMMERCIAL AND RESIDENTIAL WORK. HAD A NEW SYSTEM PUT IN AT THE BARBER SHOP. WORKERS WERE VERY PROFESSIONAL AND THE WORK WAS DONE QUICKLY AND CORRECTLY. ALSO HAD THEM COME AND REPLACE A HEATING UNIT AT HOME. SAME GOOD SERVICE AND PRICE WAS COMPARABLE TO OTHER ESTIMATES THAT I GOT. Rebecca J. We have a service contract with them so they come every six months to prepare the furnace and air conditioner. We get a reduced rate for any repairs because of the contract and we never get charged for any overtime. My parents also use them. I would recommend them. They redid our whole system in our old house. We’ve used them for 45 years. One of the guys remembered coming to our family home when I was little. Elizabeth A. They called ahead of time to let us know they were coming. They were right on time. They checked out our heater. We had just bought the house and couldn’t get the pilot light lit. The tech determined that there was air in the line, so he bled the line and got the pilot light lit. He checked out the heater and told us the heater was fine and didn’t need any more work. Theresa V. Quick response, my AC was out Friday all day and they came out first thing Saturday morning. Jordan answered all my questions, and verified the issue within first 10 minutes. I would highly recommend using them in the future. Saj J. We can help you choose the best system for your home based on your budget and needs, so you can rest easy knowing that your family will stay comfortable all year round without breaking the bank. Our maintenance team can help keep your HVAC system running at peak performance by performing regular tune-ups and cleaning out accumulated debris from dust or pet hair—something many homeowners often overlook, but which can improve performance and efficiency significantly! Our services are designed to keep your HVAC in Houston working at its best. Whether you need us for repair, installation, or maintenance services, our experienced staff will provide you with friendly customer service throughout every step of the process—from initial consultation through to completion of work—so you don’t have to worry about anything but staying comfortable in your home. Ready to see what Air Star Now can do for you? Call (713) 597-4457 today to request your free estimate from our Houston HVAC team! Our Special HVAC Services in Houston Air Star Now is a full-service heating , ventilation, and air conditioning company. In addition to regular AC repairs, insulation installation, and other standard HVAC jobs, our technicians also solve special HVAC problems, such as keeping leaves out of your outdoor unit, removing unsightly hoses or pipes that run across the floor, or helping to safeguard your equipment. We understand that the needs of each customer are unique, so we strive to offer customized solutions tailored to their individual requirements. With over a decade of experience, our team is equipped with the skills and knowledge to get the job done right the first time around. Our team can help with the installation of: Ceiling Saver Kit. If your AC unit is in your attic or the upper levels of your property and your drains get clogged, the water collected during the dehumidification process can overflow onto your ceiling. To avoid a costly ceiling repair, our team can install a ceiling saver kit that collects water from leaks. Included in this kit is also a safety switch that can cut your AC off should a clog or overflow incident occur. Condensate Pump. This pump transfers wastewater to the proper drain, and our team can install the pump in an aesthetically pleasing way so that you don’t have pipes and hoses running across the floor. Easy-to-See Thermostats. This thermostat has large, raised numbers to help those with visual impairments, and they also make a clicking sound as you adjust the degree settings of your system. Hard Start Kit. Without a hard start kit, your compressor can become easily strained when it starts up and has to work harder than necessary. This puts additional stress on the air conditioner, ultimately reducing its lifespan without proper assistance. Installing a hard start kit is an easy way to increase efficiency while giving extra support during initial operation, preventing costly repairs or replacements down the line. Kool Kap. Your outdoor HVAC unit is constantly exposed to the elements (i.e., rain, snow, dirt, leaves, debris, etc.). This debris can collect at the bottom of your unit, which is a danger to your system, as it may rust or erode. To keep leaves and debris away from your unit and keep it clean year-round, we can install a Kool Kap, which protects your condenser. Protective Remote Monitoring Devices. To monitor your HVAC system when you aren’t home, our team can help you install monitoring devices and technology. Surge Suppressors & Lightning Arrestors. During the sweltering summer months, utility companies often face a high demand for electrical power, resulting in a reduction of their output—a phenomenon known as a brown-out. Such events can lead to serious, potentially irreparable damage to your household appliances, particularly your air conditioner. These appliances are specifically designed to operate at certain power levels; when these levels are reduced, the appliances are pushed to their limits, causing undue strain. Additionally, the threat of lightning strikes harming or even destroying your electrical appliances is ever-looming. By installing a lightning arrestor within your breaker box, you can safeguard all your appliances with ease. Time Delay Relay. This device helps you avoid burning out your compressor if your system’s settings are changed too often. With a time delay relay, your thermostat won’t adjust or turn on/off until up to five minutes after the last adjustment. Many customers with children who play with their thermostat benefit from this product. Air Star Now has been helping our customers address their HVAC needs since 2011. We offer free estimates and consultations, and we pride ourselves on offering our customers tailored solutions. Whether you live in Houston, Katy, Cypress, Spring, or any of the surrounding areas, Air Star Now is your one-stop shop for all things heating and cooling. Call (713) 597-4457 or reach out to us online today to get started with a free estimate! FAQ: Your HVAC Questions Answered How Often Should I Perform Maintenance on My HVAC System? Regular maintenance is crucial to keep your HVAC system running efficiently and prevent unexpected breakdowns. It's generally recommended to schedule professional maintenance at least twice a year—once in the spring before cooling season and once in the fall before heating season. This ensures that your system is ready to handle seasonal temperature changes efficiently. During these visits, technicians can clean components, replace filters, check for wear and tear, and ensure everything is operating safely. Keeping up with maintenance helps prolong the life of your HVAC in Houston. What Are the Benefits of Upgrading to a Programmable Thermostat? Upgrading to a programmable thermostat can offer significant energy and cost savings. By allowing you to set specific times for heating and cooling to adjust based on your schedule, these devices reduce energy consumption. For example, you can program the system to lower energy use when you're not home and ramp up comfort settings just before you return. Over time, this can lower utility bills significantly while maintaining a comfortable indoor climate. As part of an HVAC contractor in Houston maintenance plan, we can show you how to maximize these benefits. Why Is My Air Conditioner Blowing Warm Air? There are several reasons your air conditioner might be blowing warm air. Common issues include low refrigerant levels, which could suggest a leak; a malfunctioning compressor; or an issue with the thermostat settings. Additionally, blocked or dirty filters can also restrict airflow and reduce cooling efficiency. It's best to have a qualified HVAC technician assess the system to diagnose and resolve the specific issue quickly. How Can I Improve Indoor Air Quality in My Home? Improving indoor air quality involves several strategies. Regularly changing HVAC filters is essential to prevent dust and allergen buildup. Installing air purifiers or whole-home ventilation systems can further enhance air quality by removing contaminants and replenishing stale air. Additionally, maintaining a regular cleaning schedule and managing indoor humidity levels can also significantly contribute to healthier indoor air. Consulting with an HVAC company in Houston can provide you with more options tailored to local concerns. What Should I Do If My Heater Isn’t Working? If your heater isn't working, first check the thermostat settings to ensure it's on the heat mode and set to an appropriate temperature. Also, inspect the circuit breaker to see if it has tripped. If these aren't the issues, the problem could involve the furnace's ignition system or a more complex mechanical failure. At this point, it's recommended to contact Air Star Now to ensure a quick and professional assessment and repair. As your dependable AC company in Houston, we are ready to help restore your comfort swiftly. Perryman Jr. Frequently Asked Questions Can I save money by using a thermostat with my system? Yes! You can save as much as $180 every year on your utility bills when you use a smart, programmable thermostat that will keep your home comfortable all year. Doing so will also put less wear and tear on the system, since it will only run when needed. How do air ducts function? The air conditioning, heating, and ventilation equipment at your workplace or home moves conditioned air through ductwork. These air passages must stay clean, and it’s a job for professionals, not do-it-yourself enthusiasts. Experts will help you seal any leaky ducts, which can boost the efficiency of your HVAC equipment up to 20%. How often should we service the HVAC system? As a rule of thumb, it’s best to call us for regular service to inspect, clean, and maintain your equipment every fall and spring, in advance of the coldest and hottest times of the year. Your Houston company or home will see the lowest total cost of ownership of the HVAC system when arranging for regular service, since it’s easier to spot problems and solve them when they’re small and less severe. When do I need to replace the system’s HVAC filters? Ideally, you will replace the filter every 90 days as the seasons change. However, if you have people with respiratory ailments, if anyone smokes, or if someone has allergies, you may need to change filters more often, such as monthly. Consult the manufacturer for details, and ask your health care professional for advice on how frequently filters need to be swapped. Can I schedule a repair service call over the weekend? Absolutely! We are always open 7 days a week, ready to answer your call and dispatch an expert to fix your HVAC, electrical, or plumbing issue. What can I do to maintain the exterior components of my HVAC system? In between regular service calls, it’s a good idea to go outside every couple of weeks and look at the HVAC equipment, getting rid of debris, weeds, leaves, and dirt that may accumulate. Blockages can harm the equipment or make it work less efficiently. You’ll always want to make a quick inspection after a major storm hits Houston. Why should I request your services over another home service company? When you need expert attention for your Houston area home's plumbing, heating, or air conditioning system, you want to know that the job will be done right the first time. All employees undergo background checks and drug tests. With ARS/Rescue Rooter, you can rest assured that all of our services come complete with our worry-free Exceptional Service Guarantee. In addition to treating you and your property with respect—calling before we arrive, using shoe covers and drop cloths as needed—we guarantee that you'll be satisfied with our work, as set out in a written estimate you approve before we start. If you're dissatisfied for any reason, we'll make every effort to meet your expectations. It's that simple. Why Do Houston Residents and Business Owners Require HVAC Services? As a leading Houston air conditioning company, ARS®/Rescue Rooter® frequently receives service calls during periods of high humidity, with customers needing a tune-up or repair of their HVAC system. It’s no wonder: Houston is known for its extremely humid climate, in particular between June and August. August is typically the warmest month in Houston, at about 94 degrees Fahrenheit . During periods of high humidity the temperature in Houston feels much hotter. Therefore, it’s essential to have a reliable air conditioner to keep your employees and customers or family members comfortable throughout the summertime. Rest assured that the team at ARS/Rescue Rooter is standing by to help in your time of need. We’ll check out your HVAC equipment and do what it takes to fix or upgrade the system. What types of problems can humidity cause that HVAC systems are able to address? Homeowners and business owners report that their windows sometimes grow foggy during high humidity. Or, you may detect a musty smell inside the building. Generally, people notice that the air feels moist, which is unpleasant and distracting. Your central air conditioner will decrease humidity levels, as the unit’s coil condenses water vapor and then drains this excess liquid. Longtime residents know that Houston also gets hurricanes and strong storms, which can damage your HVAC system, requiring professional repairs. Flying debris can strike your exterior equipment. It’s prudent to tour your property after a storm to assess any damage that will require professional repairs. Remember that these storms also can cause plumbing leaks and damaged water lines that a plumbing service such as ARS/Rescue Rooter can fix. After a flood, customers will call us because the rising water level damages their water heater. Do not try to use your water heater if it has been submerged. There is a risk of fire, especially when an unlicensed amateur attempts to check out the equipment. Heavy storm flooding can also pose problems for your lavatory. It’s not uncommon for people in Houston to find that storm surges and torrential rains lead to backed-up sewer lines. When the sewer can’t drain effectively, you may notice that your toilet is draining slower than usual. Call us for assistance if you detect this problem. Another issue after floods in Houston is leaking pipes in area businesses and homes. Our dispatcher will strive to book an appointment for service at a time that’s most convenient for you. Learn More About Houston If you have recently purchased a home or have started a business in Houston, the team at ARS/Rescue Rooter wants to welcome you to this vibrant community. Houston is renowned for being the largest city by population in Texas (it’s the fourth-biggest U.S. city ). It began as a settlement in Harrisburg in 1826. Today, Houston is a significant producer of oil and petrochemical products. High technology companies also flock to the area, where the Texas Medical Center is the city’s biggest employer. There are plenty of attractions and landmarks that set Houston apart as a jewel of a city. As plumbing professionals, we certainly appreciate the design that went into making the Gus S. Wortham “dandelion” design water fountain at Allen Parkway. Houston is also home to Sugar Hill recording studio, where Beyonce recorded her iconic “Dangerously in Love” song. It’s also attractive to engineering enthusiasts, who come to Houston to marvel at the Fred Hartman cable bridge. Families will want to make sure to visit the Sam Houston Monument in Hermann Park to foster a greater appreciation for this thriving city. We are proud to serve Houston and the surrounding area. ARS and St. Jude Partnership ARS/Rescue Rooter is a proud supporter of St. Jude Children's Research Hospital and its mission: Finding cures. Saving children.®. Learn more about our partnership here. We serve the entire Houston metro, including communities like Atascocita , Channelview , Cypress , Galveston , Huffman , Humble , League City , Missouri City , Pasadena , Pearland , Rosenberg , Texas City , Tomball , Klein , Porter and more. For optimal comfort and energy savings during summer in Houston, set your thermostat to 78°F (25°C) when you're home. If you're away, raising it to 85°F can help reduce cooling costs. Using a programmable or smart thermostat can make these adjustments automatic and more efficient. Do you provide emergency after-hours HVAC service in Houston? We are available 24/7 to take your call for emergencies. Our appointment hours are listed above. How can I improve indoor air quality in Houston? To improve indoor air quality in Houston, start by regularly changing your HVAC filters, scheduling routine maintenance, and using air purifiers. Consider duct cleaning if your home has excessive dust or allergy symptoms. Proper ventilation and keeping your home clean are key to healthier air. How often should I service my HVAC system in Houston? It’s ideal to service your cooling system each spring and your heating system each fall to ensure you find small issues before they become big problems. Do you offer HVAC financing in Houston? We work built relationships with several lenders to ensure our customers are able to restore comfort in their homes. Ask your technician about your financing options. How often should I have my furnace serviced in Houston? It’s recommended to have your furnace professionally serviced once a year, ideally in the fall before the heating season begins in Houston. Annual maintenance helps ensure safe operation, improves efficiency, and can extend the life of your system. How often should I have my air ducts cleaned in Houston? It’s generally recommended to have your air ducts cleaned every 3 to 5 years in Houston, or more often if you notice dust buildup, allergies, or musty odors. Homes with pets, recent renovations, or high pollen levels in Houston may benefit from more frequent cleanings to maintain healthy indoor air quality. How often should I schedule AC maintenance in Houston? You should schedule AC maintenance once a year, ideally in the spring before the cooling season starts in TX. Regular tune-ups help your system run efficiently, prevent breakdowns, and extend the life of your unit, especially important in Houston's summer climate. What size HVAC system is right for my home in Houston? The right HVAC system size for your home in Houston depends on factors like square footage, insulation, number of windows, and local climate. A professional load calculation ensures your system is properly sized for comfort and efficiency. Oversized or undersized units can lead to higher energy bills and uneven temperatures. Asked Questions Is it worth repairing an air conditioner? Whether it is worth repairing an air conditioner depends on the age and condition of the unit, the cost of repairs, and the expected lifespan of the unit after the repair. Comparing the repair cost to the cost of a new energy-efficient unit can help determine the most cost-effective option. How much is AC repair? The cost of AC repair can vary depending on the issue, the type of system, and the complexity of the repair. On average, AC repair can range from $150 to $500 or more for labor and parts. How long does AC repair take? The duration of AC repair can vary depending on the complexity of the issue and the availability of parts. Generally, a basic AC repair can take 1-4 hours, while a more complex repair may require a full day or even multiple visits. How much does AC repair usually cost? The cost of AC repair typically ranges from $150 to $650, depending on the issue, labor, and parts needed. Is air conditioning an urgent repair? Air conditioning is often an urgent repair, as a malfunctioning system can lead to discomfort and potentially health issues, especially in hot weather. Prompt attention to AC issues is important to maintain home comfort and prevent further damage. Who repairs air conditioners? Air conditioning repair technicians, also known as HVAC technicians, repair and maintain air conditioning units. They have the necessary training and expertise to diagnose and fix issues with residential and commercial air conditioning systems. Why is my AC running but not cooling? If your air conditioner is running but not cooling, it could be due to issues like a refrigerant leak, a blocked airflow, or a malfunctioning component. It's best to have a professional technician diagnose and address the underlying problem. Why is my AC not cooling in Houston? Your AC may not be cooling in Houston due to issues such as low refrigerant levels, blocked airflow, thermostat problems, or electrical faults. Troubleshooting and professional HVAC maintenance can help resolve the issue. How much does an air conditioner repair cost? The cost of an air conditioner repair depends on several factors, such as the type of repair needed, the age and model of the unit, and the labor costs in your local area. On average, air conditioner repairs can range from $150 to $500. What are common air conditioner repair issues? The common air conditioner repair issues include refrigerant leaks, compressor failure, clogged air filters, and problems with the thermostat, fan, or electrical components. How can I find reliable AC repair services? Finding reliable AC repair services involves researching local companies, checking reviews, and ensuring they are licensed, insured, and offer quality workmanship and customer service. What are signs my AC needs repair? Signs your AC needs repair include reduced airflow, unusual noises, poor cooling performance, increased energy bills, and water leaks around the unit. How often should I service my AC? Recommended AC service frequency is typically once or twice a year to ensure optimal performance, energy efficiency, and extended system lifespan. Can I repair my air conditioner myself? Repairing your air conditioner yourself may be possible for minor issues, but more complex problems require the expertise of a professional HVAC technician to ensure the system is fixed properly and safely. What tools are needed for AC repairs? The tools needed for AC repairs typically include a manifold gauge set, refrigerant recovery equipment, a vacuum pump, a flare tool, a tubing cutter, and a multimeter to diagnose electrical issues. How can I prevent AC breakdowns? Preventing AC breakdowns can be achieved by regularly maintaining your system, keeping it clean, and addressing any issues promptly. This includes scheduling annual tune-ups, replacing air filters, and addressing any unusual noises or performance changes. What is the average lifespan of an AC unit? The average lifespan of an AC unit is typically between 10 to 15 years with proper maintenance and care. How does weather affect air conditioning repairs? Weather can significantly impact air conditioning repairs, as extreme temperatures, humidity, and storms can strain HVAC systems and lead to more frequent breakdowns, requiring prompt attention from professional technicians. What qualifications should an AC technician have? An AC technician should have a certification in HVAC (Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning) as well as experience in installing, maintaining, and repairing air conditioning systems. They should also possess strong problem-solving and customer service skills. What warranties cover air conditioning repairs? The warranties that cover air conditioning repairs typically include the manufacturer's warranty, which covers the replacement of defective parts, and any additional warranties provided by the HVAC contractor. What are the best seasonal AC maintenance tips? The best seasonal AC maintenance tips include regularly cleaning or replacing air filters, scheduling professional tune-ups in spring and fall, and checking refrigerant levels to ensure optimal performance and energy efficiency. How does age impact AC repair costs? The age of an air conditioning unit can significantly impact the cost of repairs. Older units often require more extensive and expensive repairs as components wear out over time, leading to higher repair costs compared to newer, more efficient systems. What are the risks of delaying AC repairs? Delaying AC repairs can lead to increased energy costs, further damage to the system, and potential health risks due to poor indoor air quality. How do I choose an AC repair company? When choosing an AC repair company, consider their experience, licensing, reviews, and availability for 24/7 emergency services to ensure reliable and efficient repairs for your air conditioning system. What is included in an AC repair estimate? An AC repair estimate typically includes the cost of labor, any necessary replacement parts, and additional charges for diagnostics or specialized equipment if required to fix the issue. Can AC repairs be covered by insurance? AC repairs may be covered by insurance, depending on the type of coverage and the cause of the issue. Homeowners or warranty policies may provide some coverage for AC system repairs. What allergens can be reduced with AC maintenance? Regular HVAC maintenance can reduce common indoor allergens such as dust, pollen, and pet dander by improving air filtration, removing debris, and ensuring optimal system performance. How does refrigerant affect air conditioner performance? The amount and condition of the refrigerant in an air conditioner directly impact its performance. Proper refrigerant charge is crucial for efficient cooling, energy savings, and longevity of the system. What are the environmental impacts of AC repair? The environmental impacts of AC repair can include the release of refrigerants, improper disposal of old parts, and energy consumption during the repair process, which can contribute to greenhouse gas emissions and environmental pollution. Dallas AC Replacement Tips Dallas Plumbing & Air Conditioning April 18, 2016 12:15 pm Dallas AC Replacement – Getting Your AC Unit Replaced Is Important You must think carefully about how well your air conditioner is working. Unfortunately, it can be easy for an AC unit in the Dallas-Fort Worth area to wear out and break down. You might need to get a new AC unit installed in your home. Considering how hot conditions can be in the summer, it is important to look for a new model as soon as possible. Fortunately, you can get a great Dallas AC replacement service to help you out with getting your old AC unit fixed up and replaced as needed. It is important to see what you are getting out of this. When Do I Replace My Home AC Unit There are many points that you need to consider when it comes to getting a replacement: You’ll need a replacement if your AC unit is at least ten years of age. Your model will more than likely be out of date. You should see what the humidity in your home is like. You’ll need a new AC model if your home is too humid during the summer. Excessive dust is a sign of a need to get your air conditioner replaced. A poorly operating unit can pull particles from different areas, thus leaving added dust around your home. Excess noises in your air conditioner are clear signs of a need to get your unit replaced. The parts within your air conditioner might be at risk of harm. The key is that an older model will not be as effective as a newer one. An older model will have worn out and will need to be replaced as soon as possible. Fortunately, there are plenty of newer options for people in the DFW area to look for. The key is to just find one that you know will be suitable for your cooling demands. Choosing a New Air Conditioning Unit After you determine that you need to replace your air conditioner, you can choose a good new option. There are many good considerations to see: Think about the square footage that the AC unit can handle. See that the model can generate enough cool air to fill all the spots in your home. Check on how much power it generates. Air conditioners have become more energy efficient in recent years. Check on the footprint that your unit will take up. Air conditioners come in many sizes. You need to choose one that will fit into the foundation that an old model might have been in. Don’t forget to take a good look at the price of the AC unit. Make sure you check for one that offers enough coverage in your home at a good price. You should look carefully when finding a great Dallas AC replacement option for your home. A new AC unit can be critical for keeping your home comfortable and relaxed. By choosing the right option, you will keep your home comfortable. Read More My system went out on a Sunday, Quality 1 came out and serviced it the same day!! They got my system temporarily running which was surprising becuase I knew it needed to be replaced. They then came back out monday, and provided me with a very competitive quote including duct cleaning. We are a plumbing company that deals with other contractors and we know based off of experience the good ones from the bad ones, these guys are the good ones! Read Less L. W. Love 5 I had a 22+ years old Trane system. I always had a spring and fall maintenance program in place. While I never had any issues, or needed major repair, I felt that it was the right time to replace it... Read More I had a 22+ years old Trane system. I always had a spring and fall maintenance program in place. While I never had any issues, or needed major repair, I felt that it was the right time to replace it. I am a firm believer in Trane products having had multiple units at multiple homes all with a consistent good experience. I went to Trane’s website for a list of authorized dealers. I also asked a person I knew who is in the construction industry if his company had any experiences with Trane HVAC companies. He gave me a recommendation. I chose three companies and asked for quotes. All were certified Trane Comfort Specialists. One was the friend’s recommendation, one was a company that had performed warranty service on a mini-split system I have and the last one was a company that had good reviews. The dealer with whom I had a prior experience simply sent me an emailed price quote. The second sent a technician by who said someone will be back in contact with a price. It too was sent by email. Zach, with Quality 1 Energy Systems, came out, examined the system and took multiple pictures of it . He then spent time asking about my expectations and my likes/dislikes with the existing system. He shared his photos and made some suggestions including changing out some old duct work that should have been done twenty years ago. He later sent a detailed quote with all the individual pricing and terms. He followed it up with a phone call to answer any questions. To be fair to all companies, I sent them specific questions requesting updated figures for yearly maintenance pricing on our multiple systems, additional duct work costs, and labor charges for any Trane warranty work should it be required. One responded with caveats and minimal detail while the other, not at all. I chose Quality 1 which also happened to be the one my friend recommended. On installation day, Kevin and his team arrived and quickly started the changeover to the new system. They covered the floor and were careful in their handling of both the removal of the old equipment and the installation of the new. After they finished they shared pictures of the completed installation. It was cleaner than they found it! The system has been in for nearly a week and fully meets my expectations. Choosing the right dealer is crucial when investing in an HVAC system, especially with trusted brands like Trane at play. I am happy that I chose Quality 1 Energy Systems. From the front office (Daisy and Zach) to the technicians (Jo... Still have questions? Please do not hestiate to contact Aire Serv. How can I prepare my HVAC system for seasonal changes? Have your AC inspected and your coils cleaned before summer starts. Before winter, check your heating system, replace air filters, and test your thermostat. Routine seasonal maintenance will help to prevent breakdowns when your system is needed the most. Why does my AC make a loud noise when it runs? Banging, rattling, or squealing might be caused by motor trouble, compressor issues, or loose parts. Strange sounds shouldn’t be ignored because they usually indicate the need for a repair. How do I know if my air ducts need repair or replacement? If you have inconsistent temperatures, skyrocketing energy costs, or weak airflow, you might have damaged ductwork. Gaps and leaks in ducts will affect efficiency, and in some situations, replacing the older ductwork is the best solution. How often should I schedule maintenance for my commercial HVAC system? A commercial HVAC system needs to be serviced at least twice a year to make sure it operates efficiently. More frequent maintenance may be needed for businesses with high occupancy, like offices or restaurants with heavy HVAC usage. Need HVAC Service? Hvac Contractor - AAD Heating & Air Conditioning Air Conditioning Repair & Service in Houston TX Request a Estimate today Get Started Heating and Air Conditioning Repair Houston Learn More Heat Pumps Or Pumps Service and Maintenance Furnace and Air Conditioning Check Ups ,hvac One Stop Specialty Center AAD Heating & Air Conditioning Repair Services Air Conditioning Repair When your AC starts blowing warm air, making strange noises, or refusing to turn on, prompt air conditioning repair can make all the difference. Skilled technicians can quickly diagnose the issue—whether it’s a faulty capacitor, low refrigerant, or a worn-out motor—and restore your system’s performance before the heat becomes unbearable. Fast, reliable repairs not only bring back your comfort but also help extend the life of your system and prevent bigger, more expensive problems down the road. Air Conditioning Installation & Replacement Whether you’re replacing an old, inefficient system or installing one for the first time, professional air conditioning installation ensures long-lasting comfort and energy efficiency. Experts help you choose the right unit based on your home’s size, layout, and cooling needs, then handle the installation with precision. A proper replacement can lower energy bills, improve indoor air quality, and keep your space consistently cool—even during peak summer heat. AC & Heating Maintenance / Tune-Ups Routine maintenance is essential for keeping both your AC and heating systems running smoothly year-round. Seasonal tune-ups include checking refrigerant levels, cleaning coils, testing safety controls, and tightening electrical connections. This preventative care helps avoid unexpected breakdowns, improves efficiency, and can significantly extend the life of your system—all while keeping your energy bills in check. Emergency HVAC Repair (24/7 Services) When your HVAC system breaks down in the middle of the night, on a weekend, or during a heatwave, emergency repair services offer peace of mind and fast relief. Available 24/7, emergency technicians arrive promptly to troubleshoot and fix urgent issues, ensuring your comfort is restored as quickly as possible. This kind of round-the-clock service is especially important in extreme weather conditions where delays can affect safety and well-being. Thermostat Installation & Replacement (Smart & Manual) A properly functioning thermostat is key to maintaining a comfortable and energy-efficient home. Whether you’re upgrading to a smart thermostat for modern convenience or replacing a worn-out manual model, professional installation ensures accurate temperature control and seamless integration with your HVAC system. Smart thermostats also allow for remote access, automated scheduling, and energy usage tracking—giving you more control over your indoor climate and utility costs. Whether you need air conditioning installation, furnace repair, or routine maintenance, our team is here with fast, friendly service you can rely on. Homeowners benefit from customized HVAC options designed to match their space and comfort preferences, including smart thermostat upgrades and energy-efficient systems. content: AC & Heating | Austin, TX | ABC Home & Commercial Services Skip to main content Skip to search Austin > AC & Heating in Austin, TX AC & Heating in Austin, TX The warm weather nearly all year long makes Texans extremely dependent on our air conditioners. If your home starts to get warm or humid, it’s hard not to panic. When it comes to AC maintenance, repair and replacement, Austin homeowners count on the pros at ABC Home & Commercial Services for reliable, around the clock service. Our licensed technicians can handle all of your air conditioning and heating needs, including installation. Schedule & Buy Now (512) 837-9500 Comprehensive Air Conditioning & Heating Services Indoor Air Quality (IAQ) You don't have to live with humidity, odor, or allergy issues in your home. Let one of our specialists address your indoor air quality needs. AC & Heating Diagnostic & Repair When something goes wrong with your heating and cooling system, it doesn't take long to notice. We can find the problem and make all needed repairs. AC & Heating Maintenance & Tune-Ups Maintenance is the best way to extend the life of your system. We can make sure your home is ready for our hottest days and coolest nights. AC & Heating System Installation If it's time to upgrade your heating and cooling system, you can count on us to get your new unit installed quickly and correctly. Filter Delivery If you can never remember to change your air filters, you aren't alone. We can deliver the right filters, when you need them, right to your doorstep. 24/7 Emergency Service Available We understand that when your air conditioner or heater isn’t working properly, you want help—fast. ABC is available anytime, day or night, to make emergency repairs. Just give us a call at (512) 837-9500 , and we will quickly take care of whatever problem you are having. The ABC Process 1. Contact ABC When you contact us, we will schedule a service call to evaluate the problem. For emergencies, we will send a pro to your home as soon as possible. 2. Get An Estimate We'll provide you with an estimate for all needed services. Once we get your approval, our pros will get right to work. 3. Service We will work quickly to perform the desired services. At the end of your service call, we'll update you on what we did and any other needed follow-up. 4. Ongoing Maintenance Customers who sign up for our Advantage Maintenance Plan receive two tune-ups a year and peace of mind that their system is working as it should. We all know that keeping up with preventative maintenance is a good idea, but it’s much easier said than done. That’s why we offer our Advantage Maintenance Plan, so that you can count on us to keep your system operating at peak efficiency. When you sign up for this service, you get two visits each year to perform diagnostic tests on your air conditioner and heater to make sure everything is working properly and to perform manufacturer-recommended maintenance. After each visit, you’ll receive a written report on the health of your system and tips on how to prolong the life of your system. Scheduled routine maintenance is just one piece of the puzzle for a complete and optimal AC & Heating home environment. ABC offers air filter delivery, Smart AC monitoring, Indoor Air Quality (IAQ) assessments, and even full system replacements and installations. If it’s AC & Heating, we’ve got you covered! Get Started We offer a full range of AC & heating services. Schedule & Buy Now (512) 837-9500 Lennox, the best heating and air conditioning name in the business, has over 7,000 dealers in the US, and less than 50 receive their coveted Circle of Excellence award each year. This award is given to the top-performing dealers with elite service, elite quality, and consistent growth. ABC is the only contractor in Austin to receive this award. Now that’s a BIG deal! To celebrate this BIG deal and say thanks, we’re giving our customers a big deal too! Call for great year-round AC system rebates, deals and options from ABC and Lennox. Not only are ABC’s licensed, skilled technicians available 24 hours a day to handle your heating and cooling emergencies, but they also care about your home. Our background-checked, drug-tested employees treat your home as they would their own. In addition, we guarantee that you will be satisfied with your installation and repair services for a full year. If, for any reason, you aren’t happy with our work, we will return to make things right. Don’t just take our word for it. Austin Chronicle readers have put ABC in its Best of Austin issue year after year, in a variety of service categories. ABC’s Warranties & Guarantees ABC backs our services with an unconditional guarantee for the first full year following installation. If you are not completely satisfied with your new system, for any reason, we will work to resolve your concern or refund your investment and remove the system. No Surprise Guarantee In addition, ABC offers our customers a “no surprise guarantee”. Once the work starts, the price we quoted is the price you pay. Even if the job entails more work than expected. Comfort Guarantee If your system fails during the first year, we’ll have your home comfortable within 24 hours, or we’ll pay for you to spend the night in a hotel. Guarantee on Key Components In addition to any manufacturer warranties, we also offer the following guarantees: Compressor If the compressor in the outside unit fails within 5 years of the date of installation, we promise to replace the entire outside unit, at no charge to you. Furnace If the furnace/heat exchanger fails within 10 years of the date of installation, we promise to replace the entire furnace, at no charge to you. Lifetime Duct Guarantee All ductwork installed by ABC (both materials and workmanship), is guaranteed for as long as you own the home. Frequently Asked Questions What happens when you come to give me an estimate for a new AC & heating system? If you contact us for an estimate, one of our Comfort Advisors will take a look at your current system, ask you questions about which features and options you are looking for, learn more about your budget and determine how much you are currently spending to cool and heat your home. When we develop an estimate, we take all of these factors into account, plus any opportunities to save money through local and federal rebates or incentives. We will also suggest other improvements to help your home be more energy efficient and to lower your utility bills, whether that means adding weatherization, insulation or taking other measures. How do I know if I need a new system? You can save up to 40% on your home cooling costs simply by investing in a new, more energy and cost-efficient system. That said, just because you can get a new unit doesn’t always mean that you need to. Trust ABC to use a “whole house” approach to help you decide when you should consider replacing your system rather than making repairs. What about manufacturer and utility company rebates? Manufacturers and utility providers have a wide variety of rebates and special offers, usually seasonally. All of our Comfort Advisors are fully informed and well-versed in all necessary programs to ensure you get the best deal possible from manufacturers and local utilities. For more information, ask your Comfort Advisor. Can you work on my gas furnace or heat pump? Although we don’t have to use our heating system (gas furnace or heat pump) often here in Austin, we want to make sure our homes stay warm and cozy when temperatures drop. Just like we can help keep your home cool in summer, ABC’s pros can keep your heating system working its best in the cooler months. We can also make sure your heater is ready for cold weather by performing an annual tune-up. Thinking about a career with the ABC AC & Heating team? Watch this video & check our Current Job Opportunities Get Started We offer a full range of air conditioning & heating services. Schedule & Buy Now (512) 837-9500 Additional AC & Heating Service Areas in Greater Austin ABC serves many surrounding communities, including, but not limited to: Bastrop Bee Cave Belton Brushy Creek Buda Cedar Park Dripping Springs Elgin Georgetown Hutto Killeen Kyle Lago Vista Lakeway Leander Liberty Hill Lockhart Manor Pflugerville Rollingwood/West Lake Hills Round Rock San Marcos Shady Hollow Smithville Spicewood Sunset Valley Taylor Temple Wimberley What Our Customers Are Saying Based on 4909 reviews Mandy Rutherford 10/28/2025 “Joyner was wonderful - showed up for a service call - I Mentioned I had a hard time with the stairs and directed him to the closet up there. When he was done with the work, he mentioned he reset everything and wanted to save me a trip upstairs,mentioning he caught that I had problems with my back. It was a simple thing maybe, but super thoughtful to me. We love ABC and would recommend them for anything. Just this month we’ve had excellent service from Paul (super thorough and knowledgeable, helped us solve some problems across departments)in their lawn department and worked with Ty from their handyman services who did also did a fabulous job. Excellent company to do business with - just wonderful people.” Kathryn Heim 10/30/2025 “I would highly recommend Alfonso and ABC pest control. He was the technician who serviced our home today. He was very smart and efficient and answered all of my questions! He was a pleasure to do business with. You are lucky to have such a good employee! Thank you Alphonso for doing such a great job and representing ABC so well!” Read More Reviews Featured Blog Posts Visit Our Blog Interior Paint Finishes: Do They Matter? Are interior paint finishes really that important? The answer is yes, it matters which type of paint finish you choose. Pros And Cons Of Water Softeners Have you noticed that your dishes are coming out of the dishwasher with spots on them, or your glasses look cloudy? You may have hard water in your home. The HVAC industry has evolved significantly over the past decade, with modern systems achieving efficiency ratings that were unimaginable just a few years ago. Today’s air conditioners can reach SEER ratings of 20 or higher, while furnaces now boast AFUE ratings exceeding 98 percent. These advancements mean substantial energy savings for property owners, often reducing cooling costs by 30 to 50 percent compared to systems installed before 2010. We stay current with these technological developments to offer you the most efficient solutions available. Contact Us Schedule Your Service Today Why Professional HVAC Service Matters The complexity of modern HVAC systems demands professional expertise for proper installation, maintenance, and repair. Our technicians understand the intricate relationships between components and how minor issues can cascade into major problems if left unaddressed. We utilize advanced diagnostic tools and techniques to identify problems accurately and implement lasting solutions. Comprehensive system diagnostics using digital meters and pressure gauges Precision refrigerant management following EPA guidelines and regulations Electrical system verification ensuring safe and efficient operation Ductwork evaluation identifying leaks and airflow restrictions Thermostat calibration for accurate temperature control Your comfort and satisfaction drive everything we do at Local Air Conditioning & Heating. By combining technical excellence with responsive service and fair pricing, we deliver the heating and cooling solutions that keep your indoor environment comfortable throughout every season. Need Financing? Learn more about our financing options. Financing Ready to Get Started? Air Conditioning Services for Year Round Comfort Nothing compares to the comfort of stepping into a warm, cozy home on a chilly winter day. Our heating and HVAC services ensure your system runs efficiently and reliably when temperatures drop. Whether you need furnace installation, heat pump repair, or HVAC maintenance, our experienced technicians provide expert solutions backed by years of hands-on training and service excellence. Routine heating maintenance is essential for keeping your HVAC system performing at its best. Without proper care, furnaces and heat pumps can lose up to five percent of their efficiency each year. During our detailed heating tune-ups, we clean burners and heat exchangers, check gas and electrical connections, inspect airflow and filters, and verify your thermostat’s accuracy. These preventive services help extend system life, lower energy costs, and prevent unexpected heating system breakdowns during peak winter months.
