Home | Austin Star Services Austin Star Services Making Homes Safer, Healthier, Smarter and More Efficient Skip to content Austin Star Services is a premier Heating and Air Conditioning company in the Austin area. We’re known for delivering high-quality results while consistently keeping up to date with changes of technology, and consider ourselves the energy professional company you can trust. We go out of our way to do what’s best for you, and will ensure you’re getting the most for your money when it comes to service for your AC. Give us a call to get a free quote on the services you need — whether it’s repairs, replacement, installation or maintenance. Austin Star Services proudly provides the following Residential and Commercial services. Contact us NOW for: Emergency/ASAP Air Conditioning (HVAC) Service Emergency/ASAP Flood Service SERVICE Quick Links · Air Conditioning and Heating Service Options · Duct Services · Weatherization Service · Indoor Air Quality Service · Smart Homes Products · Water Damage Restoration (Flood Service) AC Service For most home owners and businesses the largest source of energy use – and thus the greatest area of potential for energy and cost savings – is the heating and cooling of the building. It is also one of the most neglected energy saving opportunities. Most heating and cooling systems are not properly maintained, serviced or tuned up and are not running at optimal levels. Others may not have been installed properly, were sized incorrectly or have outdated and inefficient equipment. Add to that, most have leaky and improperly sized air distribution or duct systems. Each of these problems represents significant energy waste. You can tap into this enormous energy saving potential by bringing the HVAC equipment and air distribution system up to current standards. While many people immediately turn to system replacement as the answer, there are a number of more affordable solutions to consider first – such as service maintenance, tune ups or component updating. You should also have your ducts checked to see if they simply need to be sealed or properly sized. AC Tune-Up and Service Maintenance The Department of Energy calculates that a regularly maintained system can save 10% of your AC bill. Preventive maintenance will detect small problems before they become big ones, keep your system working at maximum efficiency and minimize costly repairs. Just like cars and other mechanical equipment needs maintenance and tune-ups, so does your heating and cooling system. It is recommended that they be serviced at least 2 times per year. Austin Star offers complete tune-ups based upon the type of unit. Air Conditioning and Heating Service Options Request one of the HVAC Service Options below. Duct Services Distributing Comfort Throughout Your Home A central heating and cooling system in a home plays a similar role to that of the human heart. Just as the heart enables the circulation of blood throughout the human body, the central air conditioner and furnace are responsible for supplying air to each part of the home where conditioned air is needed. This is done by channeling the air through a series of connected ducts running through walls, crawlspaces and attics. Just like the human heart, it is important that the flow is evenly distributed to provide a healthy, comfortable system for your home. Many factors can have an impact on the distribution of air flow in your home and so it is important to consult with our energy specialists to make sure that you are getting the best results from your existing system. Duct testing and sealing is an affordable solution that can help ensure that your heating and cooling systems are running at peak performance. Beware in just sealing duct work home owners can make the problem worse, as it will choke down the airflow causing equipment failure. Some contractors do not address your duct system because of the lack of knowledge or tools to measure the performance of your duct system. If they are not testing they are guessing , and have no idea how to fix problems or even where to begin. Weatherization Weatherization is a building science requiring a combination of knowledge and skills that very few companies have. When you think of energy efficiency, most likely weatherization is not the first thing that comes to mind. However, this is the first and most effective place to start. Many times there are areas in the home where a draft can be felt around windows, doors, and other areas. If this is the case, air is escaping in and out of the home and reducing the effectiveness of running your heater or air conditioner. This may seem like an insignificant flow of air, but the cumulative effect could be equivalent to having a large hole in your wall. Obviously, having a large hole in your wall would be unacceptable, and you would want to do something about it immediately. That’s where weatherization comes in. Fortunately, this is one of the least expensive improvements that can be done to improve energy efficiency. But before undertaking this task, be sure to have a Home Energy Audit performed to detect the air leaks and assess your ventilation needs. Caulk, Weather Stripping and Insulation As we’ve learned, a “drafty” house is the result of air leakage or infiltration through cracks and openings. While many are easy to locate, such as around windows and doors, many are hidden in attics and crawlspaces, behind the stairs, around outlets and openings for appliances, and so on. Properly sealing these leaks with caulk, spray foam, and weather stripping can greatly impact both your comfort and your utility bills as the furnace and air conditioner have to work less hard to keep your home at the proper temperature. (Note: sealing leaks will not solve any problems related to lack of insulation which is needed to reduce heat loss.) Most experts agree that caulking and weather stripping should pay for themselves in energy savings within a year. For particularly “leaky” homes, air infiltration may account for 30 percent or more of the home’s heating and cooling costs and contribute to moisture, dust, insects and other issues with the home. For specific information about caulking, Indoor Air Quality Service Most people spend over 90% of their time indoors, not knowing that the air they are breathing may be more polluted than the airoutside. The Environmental Protection Agency has reported that indoor air pollution levels can be 100 times higher than the air outdoors. Breathing contaminated air puts the health of you and your family at risk. In fact, the American College of Allergist says that 50% of illnesses are caused or aggravated by polluted indoor air. So take control of your indoor air quality by reducing pollutants that can contribute to headache, lung irritation and fatigue as well as more long-term conditions such as asthma, allergies and infectious diseases. Beware of Sick Building Syndrome Every day, active families generate a large quantity of indoor pollutants. This includes hair, dander, pollen, dust, dirt, smoke and other irritants. This toxic soup is cycled repeatedly through the HVAC system and deposited tShroughout the house. Continuous exposure to polluted air can worsen allergies and asthma and could lead to chronic lung disease. The problem of poor indoor air quality has reached epidemic proportions, and the EPA has classified IAQ as one of the top five most pressing environmental hazards. Contaminated air also negatively impacts HVAC equipment efficiency. Dirt and dust mix with water to form a sticky paste that coats the components inside the evaporator coil. Once this happens, the thermal energy transfer process is degraded and your air conditioner must then work longer and harder. As a result, utility bills escalate and the unit may break down more often. We Offer … Smart Home Products Home Performance Diagnostic Services Water Damage Restoration Services What does water damage do? Leather items shrink, wood warps, and carpets begin to smell and require proper drying. It goes beyond that, so many people trust the professionals at Austin Star Services to take care of all of the fine details. Communities Served include Austin, Travis County and surrounding areas, including Kyle, Buda & San Marcos. Home Heating & Air Conditioning Services in Cedar Park When it comes to your home comfort, our skilled technicians are dedicated to providing personalized solutions tailored to your specific needs and budget. We offer comprehensive air conditioning repairs , installation and replacement , and maintenance to keep your home cool and comfortable, even in the scorching summers. When the temperature drops, we can help keep you warm with heater repair , installation , and maintenance . We also offer advanced technology, like ductless mini split units for homes without ductwork, and heat pumps for efficient heating and cooling year-round. FAQ About HVAC in Cedar Park How often should I service my heater and AC? Advanced Air Conditioning + Heating in Cedar Park recommends servicing your heater and AC at least once a year. Regular maintenance helps ensure your systems run efficiently, prolongs their lifespan, and can prevent costly breakdowns. Ideally, schedule AC maintenance in the spring and heater maintenance in the fall. What are the signs that my AC needs repair? Common signs your AC needs repair include reduced cooling efficiency, unusual noises, frequent cycling on and off, and higher energy bills. If you notice any of these issues, contact Advanced Air Conditioning and Heating for a prompt diagnosis and repair to prevent further damage and restore comfort to your home. How much do heater and AC repairs typically cost? The cost of heater and AC repairs varies depending on the issue’s complexity and the parts required. At Advanced Air Conditioning and Heating, we provide straightforward pricing and will give you a detailed estimate after diagnosing the problem. Our goal is to offer high-quality, affordable repair services to Cedar Park residents. Do you offer emergency repair services? Yes, Advanced Air Conditioning + Heating offers emergency HVAC repair services for both heaters and AC units in Cedar Park. We understand that HVAC issues can arise unexpectedly and require immediate attention. Our team is available 24/7 to address your urgent repair needs and restore your system’s functionality promptly. What size HVAC system do I need for my home? Determining the right size HVAC system is crucial for efficiency and comfort. It depends on various factors including the size of your home, the insulation quality, number of windows, and the local climate in Cedar Park. A system that is too large will cycle on and off too frequently, causing wear and tear, while a system that's too small won't adequately heat or cool your space. Advanced Air Conditioning and Heating offers assessments to determine the most suitable HVAC system for your specific needs, ensuring optimal performance and efficiency. How can I improve my HVAC system's efficiency? Enhancing your HVAC system's efficiency involves regular maintenance, timely filter changes, and using a programmable thermostat. Sealing ducts, improving home insulation, and ensuring doors and windows are properly sealed can significantly reduce energy usage. Our team at Advanced Air Conditioning and Heating can provide further suggestions tailored to Cedar Park's climate and your home setup to optimize energy efficiency and cost savings. Comfortable Homes Start with the Right System Ensuring your home stays comfortable year-round starts with an appropriately sized air conditioning and heating system. A properly sized AC and heating system will provide efficient heating in the winter without unnecessary strain, helping prevent temperature fluctuations and promoting consistent warmth. During the summer, correct sizing is key for effective cooling and dehumidification; an undersized unit will struggle to maintain comfortable temperatures, while an oversized one may cycle too frequently, failing to reduce humidity adequately. Call us at (512) 598-6923 or fill out our online form today! How to Stay Cool in Austin, TX Austin is the coolest city in the Lone Star State but it can get down right hot here. With triple digit temperatures in the summertime, you might second-guess attending that concert at Waterloo Park . Thankfully, Austin has no shortage of lakes to paddle in and waterparks to cool off at. Lady Bird Lake is Austin’s most popular spot for kayaking, thanks to a ban on motorized watercraft, which means tranquil waters for rowing. For soaking thrills, consider Typhoon Texas, an outdoor waterpark with twisting slides and a long, lazy river, or head over to Kalahari Resorts, which boasts the nation’s largest indoor waterpark, in nearby Round Rock. You can also escape the heat at one of our fine museums, such as the Blanton Museum of Art or Bullock Texas State History Museum. Or just stay in. With a functioning air conditioning system, you can relax in comfort while live streaming Austin City Limits .

Call Now Services Austin’s Source for HVAC Repair & Replacement Services Air Conditioning At Houk AC, we provide all kinds of air conditioning services, from repairs to replacements, installation to maintenance, and emergency services. We’re always ready to help homeowners in the Austin area. LEARN MORE Heating It may be hot in Austin, but heating issues are common here, especially during surprise cold snaps. At Houk AC, we can help with repairs, replacements, installation, maintenance, thermostat installation, or emergency services. LEARN MORE Indoor Air Quality The indoor air quality of your home can have a huge impact on your comfort and your health. That’s why we install a range of indoor air quality solutions such as dehumidifiers, humidifiers, air purifiers, UV lights, and air filter replacements. LEARN MORE Commercial Services Houk Mechanical—our dedicated commercial arm—provides mechanical services for a variety of industrial and commercial HVAC systems. Let us install, repair, or maintain your business’ fan-powered box system, heat pump, constant air or variable air volume system, variable frequency drives, multi-split or single-split system, chiller, cooling tower, or boiler system. LEARN MORE We’ve Got Your Back, Austin! Get In Touch With Houk AC Even HVAC problems that seem small can quickly balloon into late-night emergencies or expensive repairs. When in doubt, trust the team at Houk AC. We’ll never pressure you into a service you don’t need—we’re only here to help you achieve the comfort you deserve. Contact Us FAQs Austin’s HVAC Questions Answered How often should HVAC systems be serviced in Austin? No matter what kind of heating and cooling system you have, you should get regular maintenance twice per year: once in spring and once in fall. These professional tune-ups optimize performance, lower energy consumption, and extend the life of your system, all while preventing costly repairs and protecting your warranty. What size HVAC system do I need for my home? Bigger isn’t always better when it comes to HVAC sizing. Many Austin homes have undersized or oversized HVAC units, which can have a negative impact on efficiency and comfort. At Houk AC, we take detailed measurements and take your home’s square footage, insulation, and occupancy into account when sizing a unit. Contact us today for an in-depth comfort analysis. How much does HVAC installation cost in Texas? To find out how much it will cost to replace your air conditioner, furnace, or heat pump, use Houk AC’s online estimator tool ! With our free, personalized quotes on system replacements and the most attractive financing options in Austin, anyone can afford to get the comfort upgrades they deserve. When to Call for HVAC Repair in Austin It’s never a good idea to “wait out” problems with your heating and cooling system. Anytime your AC is blowing warm air, your heater is blowing cool air, or your system stops working altogether, call Houk AC. You can also call us anytime to investigate issues like unexpectedly high energy bills, strange noises, excessive dust buildup, hot or cold spots, or thermostat issues. Any change in your system is worth investigating! If you lose heat or air on a cold or hot day, call for emergency service right away! Temperatures above 80° or below 60° can quickly become dangerous for anyone in the building, especially young children, elderly people, pets, or people with certain health conditions. Call Now Get In Touch With the Houk AC Team Need an HVAC checkup or a repair? Houk AC can handle any kind of HVAC issue you may have to ensure your system continues to run efficiently. Our team is ready to respond with timely, trustworthy, and talented repair and replacement services. Our Location 15408 Marsha Street Austin, TX 78728 833-844-1962 Office Hours Monday – Friday: 8AM – 5PM Emergency Service Available Helping Hand Program Do you know a community member facing financial hardship? Nominate them today for a free HVAC system installation. Nominations Opening Soon Need Help? Contact Us Today at Houk AC! Contact Blog Contact Contact a Skilled HVAC Technician Do you need to schedule an annual checkup with an HVAC company, or are you experiencing any HVAC issues? If so, Houk AC can help you diagnose the problem and find an affordable solution. Contact Houk AC today to schedule an appointment with one of our technicians for HVAC repair, installation, or maintenance. Ask about our Houk Maintenance Program and current specials for even bigger savings! A rattle, a hum, maybe even a sharp squeal cuts through the quiet. Suddenly, comfort turns into concern. No homeowner wants to hear strange sounds coming from their AC. content: Home - HVAC Express Skip to content WE ARE FAST & RELIABLE SCHEDULE SERVICE UV Light for HVAC IMPROVE YOUR INDOOR AIR QUALITY A germicidal or UV light is used to kill germs, viruses, mold spores, bacteria and fungi in an air handler. A strategically placed UV light is very effective at killing close to one hundred percent of these harmful pollutants. Installing a UV HVAC system in your condensing unit — the air handler — provides a cost- effective method to clean all the air as it passes through the system. Why Install a UV Light in the HVAC System? The volume of air inside your home is immense. Treating it effectively as a whole is nearly impossible because UV lights can also be harmful to humans. Inside your air handler, however, is a different story. Your HVAC system draws the air into its evaporator unit and forces it out through air registers — the vents — placed around your home. Installing the UV light inside your evaporator unit makes perfect sense, as the air must pass over the UV light as it is circulated. content: Efficient AC, Electric & Plumbing | HVAC Repair & Installation | Austin, TX Skip to content 24/7 Residential & Commercial Service Call 512-501-2275 Send Us a Message AC, Electric & Plumbing in Austin, Texas We are proud of the broad range of services we’ve developed since we opened our doors more than four decades ago and, more importantly, of the team that stands behind them. AC Repair We’re proud to employ skilled AC repair technicians who are available 24/7 in the greater Austin area. Plus, we stand behind our work with a one-year warranty. AC Repair Services AC Installation Our team is experienced with replacing residential and commercial systems of all types. We provide free on-site estimates and high quality installations throughout Austin metro. AC Install Services Electrical From small projects to major jobs, our team of quality-driven electricians can help you achieve the safest and most aesthetically pleasing results. Electrical Services Plumbing We handle all residential and commercial plumbing needs. Whether you have a clogged drain or need a water heater replacement, our plumbing team will provide a reliable solution. Plumbing Services 5 Reasons You Should Call Us There are thousands of licensed contractors in Greater Austin. Here are five reasons to choose Efficient AC, Electric & Plumbing: 1 We do it all. Wouldn’t it be nice to know which company you’ll call if something comes up with your air conditioning, electrical or plumbing – without having to research? Since starting in 1976 as an HVAC service and construction contractor, we’ve expanded our offerings and established ourselves as a company locals can rely on for all the major systems at their homes and businesses. 2 We do it well – but don’t just take our word for it. Read the hundreds of online reviews we’ve received for HVAC installation/repair, electrical and plumbing service. 3 We stand behind our work with a one-year parts and labor warranty on all repairs. We’ve also been serving greater Austin for more than four decades, so you can trust we’ll be around to help with your service needs for years to come. 4 The person we send to your home will always be a full-time employee of our company – not a subcontractor. We believe it’s in your best interest - and ours - to send someone to your home who has a vested interest in upholding our longstanding reputation for quality and service. Every AC installer, technician, electrician and plumber on our team is also required to pass both background and drug screening. We’re a family-owned business, and we won’t send anyone to your home whom we wouldn’t want in ours. 5 We’ll never try to sell you something you don’t need. The guiding principle of our business has always been: What’s good for our customers is good for us. We work hard to earn and keep customers’ trust, which means we’ll only recommend work that’s in your best interest. If you don’t need a repair or replacement, such as an AC system or water heater, we’re not going to try to convince you that you do. Scroll to top Scroll to top Close this module Let us contact you! If you need an emergency repair, call 512-501-2275 for fastest service. Otherwise, we’ll call you within one (1) business day to schedule. Notice: JavaScript is required for this content.

Verified Review, Google Maps, 2025 When To Repair Your Austin AC System It can be hard to tell if your AC unit is in need of repair. These are some common signs that you should repair your current central cooling system: Your AC unit doesn’t start easily. If your cooling unit isn’t turning on as easily as it should, it may be time for a repair. This is common in older air conditioning systems or systems with a faulty part. Your home or business isn’t staying cool throughout the day. If you notice that your property is not able to retain cold temperatures like it used to, it’s probably a sign that your AC system needs repair. A functioning central cooling system should get your home cool and keep it cool without struggle. Your AC unit is loud. Air conditioners should not make loud, noticeable noises on a consistent basis. Of course, it is normal for your cooling unit to make some noise, as long as it’s not too loud. Any grinding, squealing, or whistling noises are abnormal. Contact Elite AC & Plumbing if you hear any uncommon noises coming from your air conditioning system. Your indoor air quality isn’t great. A functioning AC system should properly maintain your home’s air quality. If your air conditioning isn’t working correctly, you may notice more dirt and dust throughout your property. It is important to contact your AC repair specialist if you notice a decrease in your home’s air quality. Frequently Asked Questions About AC & HVAC What HVAC Services do you offer?
